result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Deppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/schooling or combination of the two, and if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

No possession of dangerous weapons. 

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed.

SAFE program. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by Department.  AODA. 

Probation review hearings. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations.
I/S to be used for rules violations.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

COUNT 2 Bail Jumping-Felony>>DRI.

21CF1456

22CF190

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation on felony counts and 2 years probation on misdemeanor counts- CONDITIONS: SAFE Program; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no possession of dangerous weapons; Probation Review Hearings; 60 days I/S Jail and 40 hours of community service I/S for rule violations; 2 DV surcharges; DNA sample/surcharge; CC; No contact with victim K.M.P. on 21CF660.

61 days credit 21CF660.

71 days credit 22CF190.
